utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: One small step for man…

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: One giant waste of your monthly allowance.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Safety’s disengaged. We're go for launch in five, four, three, two, one!

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: That was freakin' awesome!

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Aw, jeez. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: My father's gonna kill me!

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: Can I film that too?

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: What? Oh, man… Is that guy dead?

utterance.speaker: Chris
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Aah! Aah! Aah!

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: Get the rest of the flames out!

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Aah! Aah! Aah!

utterance.speaker: Ryan
utterance.content: You… you gonna be okay, mister?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: It smells like… like licorice?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Think House is coming in today?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe if we start offering spa treatments.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He already jumped off of a hotel balcony. Who knows what he'll do next?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ride some kind of prostitute chariot to work?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First person to offer me an interesting case gets to ride her… single or double-team. My scooter, which, now said out loud, sounds even more inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Seriously? You're bringing them to work now?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: 23-year-old homeless man brought into the E.R. with burn injuries and…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me guess… diagnosis was fire.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He said his burning flesh smelled like licorice, and the E.R. antiseptics like blueberry muffins.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cool. Dysosmia… could be anything from an environmental factor to an early sign of a degenerative brain disease. Smells like a winner. Okay, you and Chase go check out the park where they found him. You two load him up with Prednisone, give him an odor I.D. test. If he's still mistaking his body odors for candy, the problem's definitely in his brain. Also, find out what else he's lying about… Since I'm assuming "Ferris Bueller" is not his real name.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Seriously, who is that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They say he's a righteous dude.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Before I forget, I want you to meet Dominika. She's about to become a permanent member of Team House.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Nice to be meetings you all.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doing what exactly?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Me. We're getting married on Friday. Mount up!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I don't think that two people are supposed…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Living on the edge, baby doll!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How's the arm?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Hmm? It hurts. Do I have to check out now?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Not until we figure out why your sense of smell is off. When was the first time you noticed it?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Maybe a couple months ago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We also need you to tell us your real name, so we can review your medical records.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I didn't ask to come here, okay? I'm not paying for any of this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't worry. I don't think the collection agency has an office in the park.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I don't have a medical history. I've always been healthy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What about those scars and burn marks? Lean forward.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: My dad… We didn't exactly get along when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How many times were you hospitalized?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Never. He was good at it. Made sure he never did anything that couldn't be covered up by a sweatshirt.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: No, don't be. I'm not. The past is the past. That's why I don't like talking about it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You can't ride that thing in here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Speaking of things, I'm having one on Friday. If you want to drop by, we'd love to have you. No pressure.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're still standing on it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I am. Perhaps you're not familiar with New Jersey handicap ordinances.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Or perhaps I am. They apply to wheelchairs and powered scooters only, not toys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you any idea how much this toy cost?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For some reason, my leg's been hurting a lot this week.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: For some reason, I still don't care.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. I'll return it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I’ll have to walk it out of here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Stop. I'll make an exception for your leg. But next time, check with me first.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Congratulations on your engagement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hear a strange voice.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: A very soft-looking man. Must be the Wilson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know we said no secrets, but I think I need to take this alone, honey bunny.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Okay. Nice to be meeting you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're trying to screw with Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it's the classic "You dumped me, so I'm gonna get married a week later" ruse. 'Cause not only is she that stupid, but apparently I'm that stupid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And what, you're openly mocking marriage… trying to prove it means nothing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't. But you proved that yourself years ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'd love to keep guessing, but I've got people with tumors waiting. Why do you want us to think that you're getting married?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only one theory left… I am. Dominika needs a green card.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you're just doing some random stranger a favor? It's illegal. People go to jail for that… Pay huge fines.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you seen me practice medicine? You know how much it costs to have a live-in maid, personal assistant, cook, massage therapist, whore? I do. She's willing to work four days a week for free. It's gonna save me about $33,000.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All I have to do is say two stupid words… "I do."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And if she doesn't see it this way?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Iron-clad prenup… We go our separate ways. Your stunned look, I take it, is your way of saying, "Brilliant idea, House."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Wow. You look different.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The Prednisone has had time to work, so we need to give you the odor I.D. test now.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We need you to tell us what you smell.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Oh… Something spoiled… Maybe, rotting meat?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's baby powder.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I kind of like that one. Peppermint?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's extremely bad body odor.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Well, you got to admit, that one's kind of a good deal for me.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: My backpack. Oh, where'd you find it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In the park, right next to a big pile of questions.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What kind of drugs you shooting up?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Vitamin supplements. I've been trying to boost my immune system. All right, test me if you don't believe me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ferris tell you his real name yet?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Peter Johnson.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Danny Jennings.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I bought those books used.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: All from the same guy?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I'm sorry, you know, I think I should check out now. And I should… Ow!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Oh, my stomach.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Gastrointestinal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Is anyone else disturbed by this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What? She offered.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Danny may have lied about his name, but he was telling the truth about the vials. Tests confirm they were vitamin A and B12.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He also enjoys vitamin H. The kid's a junkie.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tox screens were negative for drug use.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His hair wasn't. I had it tested… 'Cause unlike Santa and the Easter Bunny, homeless, non-mentally ill 20-somethings without drug problems don't exist. He was a heavy user sometime in the last five months.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wow. That was incredible. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: No, thank you. I like a man with the big, strong, sexy feet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He really puts the "mani" in the "pedi."

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If he has a history of snorting heroin, he could have caused the dysosmia himself.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But we still need to explain the bleeding in his G.I. tract.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vitamin injections could have caused that… Hypervitaminosis A syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So his symptoms aren't connected.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, you buying this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not usually. But this guy's been sleeping on a bed of dog poop. I wouldn't be surprised if he's got six different symptoms for six different reasons.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The bleed could be caused by a G.I. obstruction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Vitamin O.D. makes sense, and it's easier to treat. Give him Tocopherol and zinc supplements for the excess vitamin A. If we're right… he could go homeless tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And if we're wrong, his intestines could get further distressed, while we ignore the G.I. obstruction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See what happens when women don't have to serve men to stay in the country? The get all uppity. This is why we invented green cards. Go X-ray the guy's abdomen, if it'll make you feel all equal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need a favor. I want to add my fiancee's name to my health insurance a few days early. She wants to get a tooth capped before the big day.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not signing this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I agree. I think she looks beautiful the way she is. Oh, no, wait. You're not signing that for moral reasons?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're declaring yourself the sole arbiter of true love? 'Cause you covered Taub's wife for years.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's fraud.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Voydi moya malishka

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She wanted me to bribe you, like they do back in the old country. Tell her what I said.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This is America… the land of the home and the free of the braves.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I just get teary-eyed every time I hear her say that. She brought you a gift.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Almond kulich… I make with own hands. I-it's delicious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Almond kulich… How can you say no to that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You realize if I do sign this and you don't get legally married, you'll lose your insurance with our carrier?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Fine. It's your life. I wish you both the best with it.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: North, Miss Teschmacher!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Your blood test was clean, but your hair showed heroin use.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I've been clean over three months now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How'd you kick it?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I had to die first. I O.D.'d back in November, and they said I was clinically dead for several minutes. It was like God gave me a second chance to do things right this time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're saying God cured you?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: No. State rehab cured me. But, I should be dead, but I'm not. It has to mean something. I mean, I-I must be here for a reason, right?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Did you figure out the reason?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: My goal is to become a doctor one day. I am smart. I mean, I got a scholarship for premed out of high school.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Chase… Look.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We found 13 masses spread across the wall of his colon, ranging from two to eight millimeters.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It can't be tumors. Edges are too sharp and defined.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I thought it might be parasites, but we didn't see any movement between X-ray exposures.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And no larvae or eggs were observed in any of his stool samples.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is kind of surprising for a homeless junkie living in a park.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ex-junkie… Claims he's been clean for over three months.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And he's not planning on staying homeless. He's trying to protect his health, which is why he's been taking vitamin supplements. He wants to be a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's just telling you what you want to hear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Once an addict, always an addict.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Can you… please not do that in front of me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doubt it. You're the main reason I'm on the stuff. We could be looking at fungal masses hanging off the walls of his colon. Start him on Amphotericin "B" tonight, and in the morning, run a scope up where the sun don't shine, see if you can find any truffles.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think we should boycott this wedding on principle.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I kind of have to go. His fiancee did give me a foot massage. And he invited me to be in his wedding party.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: W-what about Chase? He ask him?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yep. He's in it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You just said you weren't even going.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I still have feelings.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's that? That's definitely not a fungus.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were bleeding because you had 13 pieces of bone in your digestive tract.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We think you have pica, a craving for nonfood items that's caused by a chemical imbalance…

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I didn't crave them. I kind of… volunteered to eat them.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: W-what? Why?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: There's this great Italian restaurant I like to frequent. And by "restaurant," I mean their dumpster out back. The cook is kind of a friend of mine. He challenges me to eat stuff. Sometimes it's raw squid, or, you know, I have to chew on a chicken bone. But if I do it, then he hooks me up with real food, not just the garbage.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Great friend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: These fragments could have perforated your colon and killed you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You have to promise us you'll stop.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I think there's something wrong with my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Uh, it's like I'm looking at you from the bottom of a well.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If we add tunnel vision to the dysosmia, we can subtract the bone-induced abdominal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought the dysosmia was from heroin.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He said he never snorted, he just shot up. So that wouldn't have affected his sense of smell.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And we believe the lying liar why?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House… Are you even listening to us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll start when you decide what the symptoms are and give me some theories.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If we combine the dysosmia with the tunnel vision, the symptoms fit for western equine encephalitis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But the patient doesn't… no fever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ow! What the hell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Negative reinforcement.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about Foster Kennedy Syndrome? He could have a meningioma or plasmacytoma. Started by pressing on his olfactory nerves, it affects his sense of smell, and now it's growing and pressing on his optic nerve.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. MRI his head, find it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your potential donation…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, hey.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: …Have an immediate impact on our community. We could extend the hours…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. I just think maybe it would be a better idea to have a tour of the clinic first. It's right this way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Uh… We have several patients that are children, and we find that it's important to give them the opportunity to play to make the hospital a less intimidating place.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: M-my dad used to lock me in a closet, and it… and it feels like I can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need you to stay still.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Give him a break.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You want him squirming around? We'll have to do it twice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I want you to show him a little respect.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You really think this kid can turn his life around?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He believes God gave him a second chance. That kind of belief can be powerful.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Masters doesn't surprise me. He plays the fellow med student who dreams of being a doctor and reels her in. But you, falling for his deep connection with God?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He has hope. After all he's been through, it kind of makes me root for him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We don't even know who he is, except that he lies about who he is. The bit about his abusive father is probably all made up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And he faked the scars?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's a punk. Probably got into a lot of fights. And he sucked you in using the dad story.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I don't think I'm feeling very well. I think I'm…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's vomiting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Should I ask him to stay still while he does that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He has two dark spots in the parietal cortex. They're not tumors… Maybe some kind of, uh, injury or inborn defect.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Apparently he was clinically dead for several seconds when he O.D.'d. The dark spots could be brain damage from oxygen starvation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Except it's not. I've seen MRI imagery like that in schizophrenics. Three serving two.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But schizophrenia doesn't explain why his blood pressure skyrocketed, and he threw up in the MRI.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Panic attack. He's claustrophobic. He was fine once we let him out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The dysosmia and tunnel vision could be hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Except, as was already covered, he was screened for mental illness down in the E.R.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: In your head!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's "face."

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: On your face!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Close enough. The E.R. docs missed it, because he didn't present with major symptoms yet. We're seeing it in its infancy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So we treat him, and then what? He becomes just another schizophrenic homeless man wandering the streets… We have to help him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd love to, but I got four million other crazy people ahead of him on my to-do list, along with milk.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You two spent months trying to figure out a way to date and not have it affect your working relationship. Now you need to do the same thing for not dating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I don't.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is serious. Did you know that she's…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's dying of guilt and feels horrible for dumping me. It's great. I mean, not the dumping part, but the part where she'll now let me do whatever I want.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you're just trying to punish her? She feels bad, and your only goal is to take advantage?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not true. I got plenty of goals. One of them is a 60-inch flat screen right there.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're a lot of things House, but you've never been a sadist. You're pummeling an opponent who isn't fighting back.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I already gave him a second dose of Clozapine. You don't need…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll bet you 50 bucks his favorite sport is hockey.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How could you possibly know that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Just a hunch.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: My arm kind of hurts.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll talk to the nurse about upping your pain meds.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Hockey, eh?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, my nephew bought it for me… knows I'm a huge fan.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I hate hockey.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If this is schizophrenia, you're gonna need regular care. I found some shelters that have full-time medical staff and also offer…

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Oh, my arm really hurts!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Let's have a look.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Ow… It feels like it's on fire!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to take a look under the bandages.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Ow! No, no, no. Not that one, this one!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ahoy there, me hearties! Permission to come aboard.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Danny said his left arm felt like it was on fire last night. We assumed it was a schizophrenic delusion, but…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not. He's on Clozapine. He'd be getting better, not worse.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sounds like regional pain syndrome. Has to be a genetic disorder.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Would you slow down! You're gonna get us arrested.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I wouldn't worry about it. We'll probably die first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't make me take my shoe off!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to run his DNA. He could have early onset of Parkinson's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or cortical-based ganglionic degeneration or Huntington's or any one of a dozen other genetic diseases.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hey, if you let us out, we can start testing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we're gonna test for them all, it'll take weeks. I'm not canceling my honeymoon to treat this kid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a fake marriage, but a real honeymoon?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Most are.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Danny could also die before we get through testing for all the possibilities.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we cheat. Since it's genetic, daddy or mommy's got it too. They're either sick or dead.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He doesn't know where his mother is, and he won't tell us where his father is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's a homeless ex-junkie. Are you telling me that you four geniuses can't outwit him? Green light!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy got it for me. And now I'm drafting a request for a study into the effects of caffeine involving an Italian espresso machine and a massage chair, so make it quick.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I found Danny's father.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The kid said he was in a state-sponsored rehab last November. There's only one Danny Jennings that was in treatment at the time, and he listed his father's address as his primary next of kin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The "well done" was for making it quick. Now I'm gonna have to take that back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He lives about 30 minutes from the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the reason you're continuing to talk instead of driving there?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Chase and Masters are already on their way. Why didn't you ask me to be part of your wedding?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are genuinely upset at being mockingly snubbed by a mock wedding?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is it because I haven't been here as long as them? Or is it that you really don't like me? Or are… are you just s-screwing…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Um… I'll… I'll come back when she's finished.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She is. Oh, my God! W-what did you think she was doing? She's just installing the cable. That's not a euphemism!

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Oh, I feel sorry for the little one. Isn't there something we can do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to talk to you about your son Danny.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We're his doctors.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to know if you, or perhaps his mother, have any family history of genetic disease.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You may not care about your son, but…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Um, not why we came here. We just want to know if there's any diagnosed genetic disease in your family.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We're trying to make your son better.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shhh!

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Test.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The important question is, who are you? Danny Jennings is dead, which means that Danny Jennings has no pulse. You, on the other hand… do. Ergo, you are not Danny Jennings. Or I did the test wrong. So why don't you cut the crap and tell me your real name.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hiding your identity… Well, either you're a criminal or a superhero.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I'm not a criminal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Awesome. What color is my underwear?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I'm not telling you my name.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No problem. I just need your father's name.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Care to tell me why?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: He’s looking for me. He supposedly… cleaned up and got sober. And now he… he wants to be a part of my life again. And I can't let that happen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a big boy now. You still think he can hurt you?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: You don't get it. If I ever see my dad again… I'll kill him.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: What's happening to me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, luckily for you, we don't need daddy to figure that one out.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Did you find out his real name?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cerebellar ataxia.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That's a weird name.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The guy whiffed twice trying to pick up a cup right in front of him. That plus everything else…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means that we have whittled our list of genetic diseases… All the way down to one… Early-onset Parkinson's.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: After everything he's been through, now we have to tell him, "Hey, you have

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You could lie. I'm fine with that. But you'll probably both feel better if you give him Levodopa and confirm with DNA tests.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's gone too far. He's taking up six handicapped spaces with a monster truck.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's only four, and he's gonna get rid of it after the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And the chapel… He's turned the chapel into his own personal catering hall.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Who cares? Other than a janitor sleeping off a bender, he's the first person to use it in two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Appeasement is never the answer in the face of naked aggression. It won't be long before his tanks are rolling down your Champs-Elysees.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know what House is doing. You, on the other hand… why do you care? He isn't hurting anyone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're the first boss he's ever had who could handle him. Before you, he was either fired or buried under a mountain of malpractice suits. He needs someone to say no. He needs someone he'll listen to, when they say no. If you really care about House, you'll stop feeling sorry for him and get out there and start kicking him where he needs kicking.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, you want the fish instead of the chicken?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: This room is for patients' families, not for doctors trying to defraud the government.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, so… you've decided to take a moral stand.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah. The chapel still has sanctity for some people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. I think I saw Blue the janitor passed out in one of the pews last week.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's "Lou," and I would have thrown him out too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, where are we gonna go? We got caterers staging everything downstairs as we speak. We've got floral arrangements, place settings… Other wedding-y stuff.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's not my problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I sent out the invitations. People are coming here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's also not my problem. And I want the TV back.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: You should just let me die. The world's better off without me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's normal. People feel depressed when they get bad news… because it's bad news… Obviously.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I didn't O.D. by accident. I was trying to kill myself.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: 'Cause I've done things… Horrible things. I've hurt people. And when I didn't die, I thought… I thought God forgave me. But he just wanted me to suffer. And I deserve it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, you don't deserve it.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I… I had a girlfriend in college… And I almost killed her. I just snapped. And I started hitting her. And if her roommate hadn't come home… I'm evil. I am just like my dad. We're both monsters. I deserve to die.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: I can't… I can't… I feel dizzy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I need a crash cart in here!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: His heart is dilated and failing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And at the rate it's happening, he'll need a new one soon. And there's no way we'll get him on the transplant list.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are we missing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything. We know nothing about this kid.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Except that he's gotten worse since we admitted him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Most of our patients tend to do that, unless we cure them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, but why so fast? He had dysosmia for a couple months, never even came here to get it treated. He's just a random burn victim. We get him, boom, he's got tunnel vision, peripheral polyneuropathy, cerebellar ataxia, and now cardiomyopathy. What's different here than, say, living in a filthy state park?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think cleanliness is making him sick?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Allergic reaction? We treated him with Vicodin, Clozapine, and one I.V. bag of Levodopa.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His condition started deteriorating before that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stop that man! I need the meal card for the patient in 243. He's eating healthy… because he can. Most of the meals in here are vegetarian. Adult Refsum disease… Fits all the symptoms. His body can't process the phytanic acid and chlorophyll. It's his healthy diet of green vegetables that's killing him.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So if we change his diet…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can save his life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run him through a plasmapheresis treatment to remove the excess phytanic acid from his blood. Confirm with gene testing. Okay, I gotta go get married.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They say true love doesn't exist anymore. Maybe it never did. So without further ado…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you, Dominika Patrova, take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And do you, Gregory House, take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then by the power vested in me by the state of New Jersey just for today, I now pronounce you man and wife. You may kiss the bride.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Those of you with cameras, please feel free to provide legal documentation.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's okay. I'm just, angry at myself. I promised I wouldn't let this get to me. But it got to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Just say the word, and we will climb out that window right now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I wouldn't give House the satisfaction.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You see? Things are getting back to normal.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah… Normal.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Are you feeling better?

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: So all I have to do is eat the right kinds of food, and I'll be okay?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Basically, yeah. It's pretty limiting, and it is for the rest of your life. But if you follow the diet and get checked up regularly, you should be fine.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Thank you… for not giving up on me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You're not a bad person. You made mistakes, but we all do. Maybe when you get out of here, you can… go talk to someone… A professional.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, some of those places you suggested had people on staff. You know, I think God really does have a plan for me. And all this… It was just his way of, testing my resolve. And I wouldn't have passed it without you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: See you tomorrow, Danny.

utterance.speaker: Danny
utterance.content: That's not my real name.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I know this is not real marriage… but I really like you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like you too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I never sleep with married women. I'm going to bed. You can take the couch.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Danny disappeared without checking out.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So you called the FBI?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We didn't call them, they just showed up. Danny's DNA… When we sent it to the lab for testing, it set off alarm bells all over the country.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Alarm bells for what?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's linked to 13 unsolved murders in ten different states.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's a serial killer who eats his victims.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And we saved him.
